meanings.sent1: The dog left a pile of doody on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: Please clean up after your pet's doody.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped in some doody at the park.
meanings.sent4: The smell of doody filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The toddler proudly showed off his doody-filled diaper.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a doody and make silly mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He always acts like a doody in class.
meanings.sent3: The doody thought he could fly by jumping off the swing.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been dating a real doody all along.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was portrayed as a lovable doody.

meanings.definition: To perform a task or duty
meanings.sent1: I need to doody my chores before going out.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure to doody her responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: He doodied his homework quickly so he could play outside.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together to doody the project on time.
meanings.sent5: She promised to doody her best in the upcoming competition.
